website_summaries.verdict: Bare bones but reliable, this tank of a unit is hard to beat for the price.
pros: Inexpensive unit that features Sony reliability
Battery backup, decent speaker, wake up to alarm or your favorite radio station
cons: A very spartan unit with a battery backup that only keeps track of time and won't power the alarm

customer_reviews.title: Does not keep time
customer_reviews.text: I've had this clock since 2015 and it's just not good, it slowly loses track of time. I have it plugged into a wall, so it's adequately powered. But, without fail, it gets slower and slower as the days go by. Initially I thought it was a brief power issue that caused the problem, but every time I reset the clock it continually falls behind the actual time. I last reset it about 3 months ago and it's currently running 5 minutes slow. That's pretty unacceptable for an alarm clock.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Elegantly simple, supremely functional, best in class at $20.
customer_reviews.text: Clean, simple, aesthetically pleasing design. Not too big, not too small. Adjustable brightness. Solid snooze bar. Radio gets clear signal (at least inside a large NYC building). Speaker is loud and clear. No frills, just another solid entry into Sony's decades-long run of producing excellent digital alarm clocks. The price is right at $20 - this can't be beat.
customer_reviews.author: E. Willyard

customer_reviews.title: Lasted Five Months
customer_reviews.text: Bought in June '17. All worked well until Nov 4-Daylight Savings Time. Had it on auto for time change and the correct time zone. Now can not get it to show correct time-always 15 min slow even if I try to set it manually. Spent over two hours trying to reset manually and finally unplugged it for a couple of days to see if it would reset itself. Nothing. Wish I had listened to the previous number of reviewers who said it was junk. Sony is lacking at this point. If I could return it, I would.
customer_reviews.author: DonnaB

customer_reviews.title: A great clock radio!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice clock radio and very easy to program. Sound is quite good for it's size. I would buy this product again if given a choice!
customer_reviews.author: wanda e rowland

customer_reviews.title: Small Compact Size
customer_reviews.text: It is a very nice cube shaped clock radio with multiple functions. You'll need a degree in engineering to learn how to set the time or alarm. Fortunately my husband is an engineer and helped me out. I'd give it 5 Stars if it weren't for the goofy method of setting the time and alarm time.
customer_reviews.author: JNolf

customer_reviews.title: I bought three of these clock radios because I loved the compact design only to find that every one ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought three of these clock radios because I loved the compact design only to find that every one of them loses time. The one I bought first is behind the most with the others keeping pace at about one minute per month of time lost, and from what I can tell you can't actually set the time manually, it's supposed to be atomic time received automatically. Now it's too late to return them. I don't get how they could still be selling these since every one of the three I bought malfunctions in the exact same way, so I assume they all do.
customer_reviews.author: M.

customer_reviews.title: Great little clock/radio!
customer_reviews.text: Actually, I am really pleased with this clock/radio. It is very compact,but the readout is extremely easy to read. There is a dimmer bar so you can adjust the brightness of the readout, which I love. It automatically changes for daylight savings time, which is wonderful for us in Indiana! The clarity of the radio is really good. I even kind of like the added quirkiness of the "cube" look. I received the product in two days and the company wanted to know if all went well with the transaction. Great overall purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Colleen O'Neill

customer_reviews.title: Tuner is AWFUL
customer_reviews.text: I should have looked closer (yes, MY FAULT), but I ASSUMED something from Sony would be at least decent. But the station tuner on this unit is PATHETIC! A thumb wheel that turns an analog numbered disk with tiny print you "see" through a TINY-TINY view window. I'm not making this up. Digital clock with mechanical, analog sketchy tuning. A minuscule movement of the thumb wheel gets you off the frequency and no clear way to know where you are.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Great Alarm Clock
customer_reviews.text: Perfect radio alarm clock for anything. My intended use for this clock is the radio function. I wanted a small, compact radio for my shelf that is just loud enough for some background music as I'm doing work. It is easy to tune and get a nice, clear signal. It will fill up a medium-sized room of sound wonderfully. I am really satisfied with this purchase. I also like the easy to read time. It also automatically adjusts to daylight savings. I don't live in an area that has DST but I'm sure it is a huge plus for DST people.
customer_reviews.author: Connor K.

customer_reviews.title: Update: did not last 6 months!
customer_reviews.text: Good price and I like that the clocks dial is orange. My last clock had blue numbers, and they were BRIGHT at night. Not a problem with this clock. Update: Not even 6 months later, this clock died. The radio began running constantly and could not turn it off. Then the following day, I hear a beeping noise, and it's the numbers continuously cycling and could not be stopped. I unplugged it, and after waiting a few days, I plugged it back in, and guess what, it won't even let me adjust the time, the alarm, nothing. Most of my other alarm clocks lasted much longer, and especially. VERY disappointed in the quality of this clock.
customer_reviews.author: MGS Va Beach

customer_reviews.title: Good clock/radio no presets.
customer_reviews.text: Small like I wanted. Speakers are loud orange is light on display is perfect in any light and not to bright at night. The only thing that I didn't like is that radio tuner isn't digital so it's a bit annoying trying to find the stations I want. There are no presets so if you want to change stations you have to move the tuner each time. That is my only complaint.
customer_reviews.author: Nina

customer_reviews.title: It's supposed to be a clock
customer_reviews.text: After having this clock for some time, I suppose that the most irritating thing about is it that fails to keep the correct time. The design is actually fairly nice, being unobtrusive and stylish. Further, the illumination hits the sweet spot between poor visibility and annoying brightness. But I really needed it to keep reasonably accurate time. After several months of resetting, I'm at the point of looking elsewhere, which is frustrating when I just purchased an alarm clock. I regret choosing this item.
customer_reviews.author: armlabes

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Decent radio, reasonable sound, a bit more bass on the radio than I expected. Analog dials, so wheels must be spun carefully to tune. Pleasant "start low, don't startle, and then Get GRADUALLY LOUDER UNTIL HE WAKES UP" alarm feature. Shipped with a dead lithium button cell back up battery, which I replaced from the dollar store. I had to actually read the directions to set it up, because of date and time settings, and they were adequate. I'd buy it again, or recommend to a friend (hello random internet friends).
customer_reviews.author: Dean Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Nice device, very poor radio
customer_reviews.text: Initially it had some great features - 3 brightness levels, easy snooze button, easy to see and use. But the radio is not digital, it is analog with a wheel to change stations. So one moment you get a good signal and the next you get static or nothing at all. This week alone I missed the radio alarm twice as it turned on but the radio did not pick up a station (even though it did the night before when I tested it the night before) and was late to work. It did not say it was not a digital radio. Really disappointed as the rest of it is really nice.
customer_reviews.author: Knight At Last

customer_reviews.title: Great little clock! Ignore the idiotic reviews about "automatic time set" not working
customer_reviews.text: This clock is great. Keeps perfect time. Has a backup battery. Amber LED readout is pleasant, dimmable and emits hardly any light but is easy to see. Radio works great. Huge upgrade over the very old Sony it replaced. Some reviewers are critical of the "Automatic Timekeeping"feature, which does not exist. Others can't seem to set the time. See, the time setting buttons are on the back since you don;'t often need them and that way you won't hit them when half awake when you are really reaching for the snooze button. These reviewers should be very careful when handling scissors, tying their shoes or operating a microwave in case they accidentally harm themselves.
customer_reviews.author: Spork

customer_reviews.title: As many reviewers reported, mine was of very poor quality and defective out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: Basic alarm clock with advantages of a red display that is adjustable in brightness and “reasonable” in effort to set time/alarm. Poor design layout for switches and materals but was expecting that in a basic clock. Mine arrived with a malfunctioning displaying for a backup battery problem. Thought the battery that came with it might be dead but my replacement battery did not help so returned product. Having seen product I will not reorder. Shocked Sony allowed their name on this product but have not been around a Sony product in some time now.
customer_reviews.author: Krista Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use as a radio in my office and have tolerated it for the past 2.5 years. Today I've had enough!! I constantly lose signal and lose the stations all together. I'm not sure why in 2018 I can't listen to the radio on an actual radio!! For the time being I'm listening to my station on my phone. I will most likely get an echo dot to sync my phone. I saw another review stating this product doesn't keep time and had to laugh because mine is 9 minutes slow!! If you're considering buying this product to use I a radio I'd save you money and get something else!!
customer_reviews.author: Magess

customer_reviews.title: The white clock‘s display  is significantly brighter than the black clock
customer_reviews.text: Overall it’s a good alarm clock. Radio tunes better than expected. However the white version’s LED display was too bright for me even on the lowest setting. Black version is good.
customer_reviews.author: Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Paying for the aesthetic
customer_reviews.text: This alarm clock does it's job but is mainly aesthetic. It's not particularly loud and the radio isn't impressive. For $20 i guarantee you can buy a better alarm clock however what this clock does best is looking good. You're mainly paying for the aesthetic as not many alarm clocks look like this. Just don't get confused that it will have sleek features that come with the sleek design cause it won't.
customer_reviews.author: Mateo N.

customer_reviews.title: Runs slow. Battery doesn’t work.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve never seen a digital clock that runs slow until now. The time quickly falls out of sync with reality after setting. Also, despite trying multiple new batteries it does not hold the time in a power failure. There’s supposed to be a symbol that shows on the front of the battery is low, but that never displays. I also wanted this clock with the hope of having a dimmer display, but it is still somewhat bright at night.
customer_reviews.author: ILB

customer_reviews.title: New version doesn't quite add up.
customer_reviews.text: This model replaces the ICF-C121 and 122. Both of these had remarkable sound, better sound than most larger clock radios. This new model is slightly smaller in cabinet size, and the sound, while still better than most larger clock radios, is not up to the old standard. The earlier models used a 9 volt battery for backup. The new model uses a button lithium battery. The battery on my new unit died within a few days, so that's how I know it is impossible to replace the battery without destroying the battery holder. So I guess I'll have to live without battery backup.
customer_reviews.author: Paul A. Powell

customer_reviews.title: Wakes us up in the middle of the night.
customer_reviews.text: We have two. The one we bought first at an in-person store works great, and we like it. We bought a second from Amazon when another clock-radio died. The one from Amazon woke us up today at 1:35 am with loud buzzing, not the time that the alarm was set to, and the alarm was not even activated. And it woke up my husband twice in the middle of another night, which is why I specifically made sure alarm was set to 7 am and that the alarm was not set to go off. And Amazon requires us to send the thing back, even though we don't have the box anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Schwartz

customer_reviews.title: Black and White at a cross roads.
customer_reviews.text: Box arrived fine -- No problems. I need to say -- the white model which I also have has 2 alarms, while the black one has one alarm. The web pages does not show the top so you can see what you get. The terms are different, but I went ahead anyway. The device ran excellent. Kept directions in hand thru out, and downloaded what I could find to my hard drive. Controls may not be intuitive. Took about 5 to 10 minutes to confirm I could run it properly. Buttons seem flimsy, I believe it will hold up for my term on this product. The whites review can be found elsewhere on my reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel D'Errico

customer_reviews.title: Good and bad.
customer_reviews.text: The GOOD: Very simple to setup with excellent instructions written by someone who knows English. If you want to get up a few minutes earlier you can simply set the alarm back a few minutes without having to go ahead by almost 24 hours. To me this is a big convenience that so many manufacturers have deleted. It's a very compact 4 inch cube. Cheap price. The BAD: Very weak reception, very poor sound quality, and the cheapest little circular tuner. But I guess not too much can be expected at this low price. Since, I don't like buzzers and will only listen to the wake up music for about a minute it works for me.
customer_reviews.author: paulscott

customer_reviews.title: Alarm Clock with Controllable Brightness
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with this clock. Arrived early, packaged well, took it out of the box, plugged it in and its on board battery backup restored the right time for me (Eastern). Clock is simple, smart looking in black and does the job. Very very important was the fact that the brightness can be dimmed. Has three settings for brightness - high, mid, low. Cannot turn the brightness to nothing, but the fact that the numbers are orange lessens the impact and avoids sleep disruption. Radio has AM/PM and sleep function
customer_reviews.author: LB of Aurora

customer_reviews.title: Meets the need
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set alarm and correct automatic clock time if needed. Snooze bar controls 3 brightness settings for display. The alarm timeset button top rear is right next to the alarm on/off slider so if you overshoot the quick radio/alarm reset button further towards top front, you can easily but unintentionally disable the alarm or a snooze until 24 hours later, and oversleep. But it does allow you to easily sleep later with the alarm still on than the typical snooze bar delay options. The sound quality of the radio is mediocre, but typical of a small clockradio; gets the job done. Compact size is great for the functionality.
customer_reviews.author: skw smith

customer_reviews.title: Good basic clock radio
customer_reviews.text: Nothing fancy, just a basic clock radio, purchased a few years ago and still working fine. The black on black buttons and controls are hard to read, though once you know how to use it, that's not a big deal. The internal battery is nice; you don't have to reset the clock after power outages. The display isn't too bright, the radio gets decent reception and it doesn't take up much space on the nightstand. Based on other reviews, the quality control may be inconsistent, but I've had no issues with mine.
customer_reviews.author: Jo Landers

customer_reviews.title: Not as expected
customer_reviews.text: I am elderly and had one of these Sony cubes for years. I saw this one and thought wow, the search for a basic clock radio is over ! It didn't last two months. The sound quality is not what it used to be. The letters seem dimmed. The antenna for the radio is the electrical cord. The cord antenna completely quit working . It doesn't have an alternative alarm so I had to throw it away. I see that Amazon.com has a Sony cube, different model number, higher price, I would get that one instead.

customer_reviews.title: Clock has one job and it doesn't do it...does not keep the time!
customer_reviews.text: Clock does not keep time, within 6 months it started losing time, I did the troubleshooting and it did not help. Buttons are unresponsive. It is under a year and I have to buy a new alarm clock as I don't want to go through the time/expense to mail it to have it serviced...ridiculous. Shame on you Sony, I used to look for Sony as I knew it would be a good product, not any more.
customer_reviews.author: Eva

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Keep Time
customer_reviews.text: This clock radio does not keep time well. I bought two of these, one for each side of the bed. The two of them stay perfectly in sync with each other, but are slightly off. Each month they both creep forward a minute fast. Basically after 5 months, they would be 5 minutes fast. Its kind of aggravating since they are digital and made by Sony. it seems that should be able to keep perfect time. Everything else seems pretty good. No real complaints.
customer_reviews.author: kevron

customer_reviews.title: What’s up with this Sony alarm clock??
customer_reviews.text: I am in total agreement with a couple of the reviewers - this clock changes time and alarm wake time. At first I thought I was unknowingly hitting a button that changed the alarm wake time, which was becoming a problem, so I stopped using it as an alarm and started using my cell phone as my alarm. Two weeks ago I realized the clock had changed by a complete hour. I would not recommend this clock. Also you need a PhD to set the time and alarm. The buttons are small and use of them is illogical. Other than the slow to fast alarm, I do not recommend this clock.
customer_reviews.author: cawo

customer_reviews.title: Compact trash
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two of these: Neither would set the time automatically, as per instructions and product description. After setting the time manually, neither would retain the "atomic" auto setting if unplugged for a period of time; clock had to be reset manually every time. This is more crap under a brand name. Look elsewhere. Radio reception, however, beats the unit I was intending to replace with this SONY. Big deal, since the archaic & defective clock function kills the deal.
customer_reviews.author: Lou

customer_reviews.title: Wife not happy
customer_reviews.text: I'm hoping the replacement works. This one makes a scratching sound about every hour for about 10-15 seconds. The radio is off, no alarm set and volume to zero. It has been doing this since I set it up about a week ago. All night long. I guess I'm a slow learner, but my wife put an end to it last night, by unplugging it so she could sleep.
customer_reviews.author: No fluff

customer_reviews.title: Works as Intended.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use for a radio at work. it does fine the majority of the time but I have noticed that depending on where I am in my office my signal will go in and out, I'm assuming that the human body has some sort of effect on the FM frequency. I guess it would be nice if it had some sort of antenna to nullify this effect but other than that I can complain. Cant complement on its abilities as an alarm though as I haven't used it but the radio works and it keeps an accurate time.
customer_reviews.author: Russell

customer_reviews.title: This radio alarm clock delivers
customer_reviews.text: I was THRILLED with this clock for the following reasons: --> dim orange display dims even further for maximum dimness when I'm trying to sleep, unlike my previous clock, the green display of which was visible from space even on the "dimmest" setting --> it does the things I want it to do and not the things I don't want it to do --> it doesn't talk back (screw you, Alexa!) --> design, design, design: it's pleasing to look at, easy to use and just all-round well designed. I probably am much more emotionally invested in this black cube than I should be. If I could give it 19 stars, I would.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Jäeger

customer_reviews.title: Hotel style alarm clock
customer_reviews.text: Great little clock radio. LOVE the orange light as it doesn’t disturb sleep at all! Bought two of these...one for home and one for my apartment. Great choice! I would highly recommend. I know every phone has an alarm clock, but it’s nice just to wake up in the middle of the night and be able to look over and see what the hell time it is without turning on my phone that’s as bright as the sun!
customer_reviews.author: MJ Bartanis

customer_reviews.title: Unusable after 2yrs (constant cycling)
customer_reviews.text: Worked okay for about 2yrs but now cycles continuously through times as others have indicated as well. Unplugging and pulling battery did not resolve, so clock is now useless. When it did work, main complaints were: 1) time was always off by a few mins 2) time could not be adjusted 3) clock radio is hard to tune precisely 4) speaker sounds like a tin can. But the main issue is that there seems to be a fundamental design/build flaw (described above and in other reviews) that will likely render the clock a brick in 6-24mos. I've had very cheap clocks last longer and perform better than this one. I seriously doubt Sony will warranty or resolve this one...
customer_reviews.author: WK

customer_reviews.title: Not Great
customer_reviews.text: $70 retail. You must be joking. It seems to be of OK quality and somewhat functional. Tuning is very difficult, not backlit and complete analog. There is a little knob on the side and a little window on the top to tune the radio. NOT DIGITAL TUNING. When you brush the knob especially at night, it is impossible to find your way back to your channel. You have to use a flashlight or turn on the lights to do this. Buttons on the top and back, knobs on either side. Wow, not functional. Sound quality is fine, build quality is not fantastic. Just not what I was expecting for something purported to be worth $70.
customer_reviews.author: G. Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Great little clock
customer_reviews.text: Great little clock. It was set correctly when it arrived. Pros: Small, easy to use, dimming display, no cord radio reception, DST auto adjust. Cons: no alarm during power outage, lacks 2day,5day, 7day alarm option, I would prefer a DST switch versus programming it. Wish List: - I wish the alarm could alert even during loss of power. Unfortunately, it will only track the time during a power outage, but not sound the alarm during outage. - I also wish it had 2day, 5day,7day alarm options. - Dual alarms would have been a nice addition, but unnecessary.
customer_reviews.author: Carmine D

customer_reviews.title: Nice, functional alarm clock
customer_reviews.text: For the size I will give it a 5 stars, for the quality 4 stars, for the alarm sound 3 stars. The positive side of this alarm clock is the nice design and appropriate size. Functionality is practical and easy to learn. My disappointment is the max volume of the alarm (unless you want to use the radio to wake you up, then it is adequate) which could just be in my case since I'm a heavy sleeper. As far as the quality, you get what you pay for leaning more of having a cheap plastic feel to it. Overall, I'm satisfied with it but would not in the most enthusiastic way because of what I mentioned earlier.
customer_reviews.author: Prissy

customer_reviews.title: unreliable
customer_reviews.text: the radio tuning is mechanical and it does not lock in to the radio station signal. which means for me, I wake up late because the radio is not tuned to the station. one of the two I bought does not provide a battery backup. inoffensive looks but I think function and ease of use was sacrificed to form. I also bought a Sony ICFC1PJ model that does tune electronically so it is reliable. but with the added functions, it is even less user friendly. they are nice looking and small enough to leave room on your nightstand. easy to read but I don't think the brightness is adjustable. I would not recommend this model.
customer_reviews.author: sloop

customer_reviews.title: you're going to have to spend some good $$$ to hire someone to set the time on ...
customer_reviews.text: A word of advice: you're going to have to spend some good $$$ to hire someone to set the time on this clock. Even my kids, computer wizards all, couldn't figure it out. Maybe it was just this one clock. If nothing else, it became a funny conversation topic at the dinner table. As for me, I don't need my bedside clock to let me know what day and year it is. I only need to know the $%#damn time. I threw it out and bought another clock. Good riddance.
customer_reviews.author: CVP

customer_reviews.title: Garbage once auto set dies
customer_reviews.text: I have had this alarm clock for about 18 months and it no longer keeps time. It's auto set feature has not worked for months and has gradually gotten further off time. I finally got annoyed by it being 18 mins slow and pulled the battery to reset the time and now all it does is flash the default time. So now it is useless as a clock and functions poorly as a radio, do not buy it won't last and if you already have one do not pull out the battery because it will cease being a clock that is just off.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Perfect way to avoid playing on your phone first thing in the morning!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a way to wake up in the morning without being tempted to play on my phone. However, most of the products out there were either beeping alarm clocks (ew) or had features I don't really care for like indoor temperature (seriously, who cares?)... This FM alarm clock was the best deal I could find and it also looks really nice on my night stand. Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: C. Lemus

customer_reviews.title: Sexy, stylish and functional....
customer_reviews.text: just like me. Works fine, simple set up...even an old man can do it. Really people, it comes with directions, try reading them or find a sharp 6 year old. I got it, because it just looks cool. However, it actually works just fine. Hey, I can actually find this mysterious alarm/ off / reset button...hit it on the first try. I'm GOOD.
customer_reviews.author: Tmanqz

customer_reviews.title: It has a mind of it's own
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this clock/radio 2 years ago. I thought it was complicated to set up but once I got it, I haven't touched it since. Recently, it has taken on a mind of it's own. The radio will come on at random times during the night. I've check the settings and the alarm is still set to off but it keeps happening. It will flash the time and then flash OFF but a few minutes later the radio will come on again. I finally just turned the volume all the way down. I'll be searching for something new now.
customer_reviews.author: J Alpert

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended
customer_reviews.text: I was going to use this in our bedroom. I guess I missuderstood the advertising thinking it had the ability to be set with 2 alarm settings. Not so. The radio reception is poor at best and the speakers are about the same. I thought I would use it in my shop as a clock and radio, but the radio doesn't work with my florescent lights. I'm disappointed because it's not worth paying to send it back. I would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: This clock is a nice size and the price is reasonable
customer_reviews.text: This clock is a nice size and the price is reasonable, but I give it 2 stars because of the alarm volume. I bought this strictly to use as an alarm clock, but you cannot adjust the alarm volume to be very loud. My work schedule varies, so sometimes I need a little more volume on the "early mornings" but this cannot be adjusted loud enough. The maximum alarm volume is so quiet that you would think it is on the lowest volume setting. As just a clock, this is great, but as an alarm clock, it's unusable......unless you are a very light sleeper.
customer_reviews.author: A. S.

customer_reviews.title: It would be a good product if it worked properly
customer_reviews.text: It would be a good product if it worked properly. It often starts to make a buzzing/clicking sound in the middle of the night, which wakes me up. I am also sometimes unable to turn the radio off, so I have to turn the volume down all the way. I'm not sure what is wrong with this, but it starting acting up more than 30 days after purchase, so it is too late to return.
customer_reviews.author: DThal

customer_reviews.title: Asthectically pleasing. Internals are garbage. Poor QA
customer_reviews.text: Suprised about how light this was. Turned on the unit. Even with crystal clear FM reception, the speaker crackles and rattles in the housing. Took apart the unit and tightened the speaker. Helped a little, but the speaker is still worse than any cell phone speaker I've heard. Distorts at 75% volume. Took apart the rest of the unit to examine. Very cheaply made. Questionable Chinese Rs & Cs. Crappy soldering. Probably cost $5 to build assemble and ship to the US. I salvaged the display for a future project and threw the rest in the trash. Sony used to mean something of quality and the brand had a good reputation, but now its just chineese garbage. -Electromechanical Engineer
customer_reviews.author: G

customer_reviews.title: Looks good, no ambient light.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this clock to replace one with a super bright display, my only needs for this are an aesthetically pleasing clock with a display that doesn't light up the room. I've had this clock for about a month and I couldn't say whether the radio or alarm even function. This clock looks great, the display almost appears to be floating in a pool of black, the display project little/no ambient light.
customer_reviews.author: M. Evans

customer_reviews.title: A Fatal Flaw -- Won't Keep Time
customer_reviews.text: I bought this alarm clock back in October, having used a similar Sony model for many years. Over the past month or so, this one has refused to keep time -- it consistently runs fast, gaining a few minutes each day whether I set it myself or use the automatic function. I finally gave up and now use my old manually wound travel clock, which is a much more reliable time keeper.
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money!
customer_reviews.text: Sony has failed! Time doesn't keep. Start lagging behind as soon as you set it. Lags behind 30-40-50... mins. I gave up resetting it. Just terrible product. Used to have a white cube Sony clock radio for more than 25 years. The only reason I had to get a new one was the little plastic toggle in the back to set minutes finally broke . This one is TERRIBLE! Wasted money. Wish I could get my money back. Getting a new NOT Sony clock radio.
customer_reviews.author: OldNew

customer_reviews.title: Great alarm clock!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this alarm clock! I didn't put much thought into this purchase, just chose something I thought looked nice. I've been very pleasantly surprised. I love that the alarm starts with a quiet beep and becomes increasingly loud if ignored. This means that I can hear my alarm go off without it waking my husband, but also needn't worry about sleeping through an alarm. The snooze goes in increments of 10 minutes, if you push it 3 times you can gain an extra 1/2 hour... sometimes necessary after a restless night. It also adjusted on it's own to daylight savings hours. Great little clock.
customer_reviews.author: K. Murray

customer_reviews.title: Beautifully functional
customer_reviews.text: This replaced my 33 year old Sony alarm clock radio that had bounced off the wall a few too many times. My only complaint would be that the buttons are a bit small and their functions are not well marked. My eyes not being as young as they used to be would account for most of that complaint, but I think they could improve on this point at least a bit. Just a suggested improvement more than a complaint really. I couldn't find a better alarm clock, that's why I bought this one and I am very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: DBZ

customer_reviews.title: I loved this little clock while it lasted
customer_reviews.text: I loved this little clock while it lasted. I bought it June 2015 and it just started malfunctioning this week (So it lasted one and a half years). I had the Sony Dream Machine for 10+ years before that, so I really wish that it would have lasted longer. A few days ago, the radio turned on all by itself and the alarm clock stopped working, If you try to set it, it starts doing an endless loop. The clock still is working, so am still using it until I can find a suitable replacement. If you change out your alarm clock every couple of years this is a nice one :-(
customer_reviews.author: Kami Huyse

customer_reviews.title: Loses time--read negative reviews
customer_reviews.text: Alarm clock may look nice but it does not last. In a year, mine began losing time and the time adjustment button was unresponsive. Batteries were not the issue. 15% of reviewers give this clock a bottom-level rating, and they are right. Many of them complain of similar problems. The mere fact that it is not expensive does NOT mean that it is a bargain. Yes, the buttons are very hard to read, and you have to set year and date before you can set time. I replaced mine with an RCA fo about the same price. Read other reviews before buying.
customer_reviews.author: Darwin N. Patnode

customer_reviews.title: Does Not Keep Accurate Time
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these clock radios, one for either side of the bed. I generally like them, but both of them gain roughly one minute per month. I noticed a few months after we switched from daylight savings to standard time that both of them were a few minutes ahead of other clocks in the house, all of which were set at the same time. Unless you want to get up several minutes earlier than you need to, you will need to manually reset these clock periodically. That kind of defeats the purpose of the built-in automatic switching function that changes to daylight savings and back every year.
customer_reviews.author: The Herm

customer_reviews.title: Great alarm clock!
customer_reviews.text: I have always liked Sony alarm clocks and my opinion has not changed after buying this clock. This is a very nice, solid little clock. Very easy to set up and the radio reception is better than I had expected. Really like that there are 3 settings for brightness and based on my research, Amber is the best color choice for your eyes/nighttime. Enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: D.W.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Product is okay, but doesn’t come as advertised. According to the manual, this clock comes with a button battery and I need to install it by myself. However, when I received it, the battery was installed and drained out. Don’t know why this happened, but I would return this product because of this.
customer_reviews.author: Mason

customer_reviews.title: Last One Lasted 10 Years
customer_reviews.text: I had an older version of this alarm clock for almost 10 years. I finally upgraded because my wife said it was so ugly. I have to admit that after 10 years of use, the white was not so white anymore. This clock has been just as simple to use and I hope it too will last me 10 years. I think the Sony's are worth the little extra because I need an alarm to wake me up. The speaker and radio reception is acceptable but hopefully that is not someone's primary purpose for this item. With all of the modern ways to listen to music, an alarm clock is a horrible choice.
customer_reviews.author: etsu0000

customer_reviews.title: Sony is losing the quality battle.....  Stay away...
customer_reviews.text: Less than a year, the time adjust buttons stopped working. Buttons difficult to read and in poor location. Cheaply made. Bought to replace a cube we bought several years ago. Definintly not as well made.
customer_reviews.author: DeacMom

customer_reviews.title: The size and display are great, but once again
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, the radio doesn't function at all. I just received it and took it out of the box. I followed the instructions, pushed radio, adjusted volume, moved the dial to find a station, but there is no sound of any kind, not even static. Bummer. The size and display are great, but once again, we have a defective product right out of the box. This is happening a lot these days. Since we want the radio for the alarm, it isn't going to work.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: compact.  Great alarm clock
customer_reviews.text: This alarm clock has everything. I love how it has the capability to have a noise alarm and radio. I also like the fact that you can dim the brightness of the screen. We just had daylight savings time and it automatically change the time. One other fact I like is that you can adjust the volume easily. It is made well. So far no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: bes

customer_reviews.title: Great clock if you like to be late.
customer_reviews.text: We have two of these and both of them lose at least a minute a week. The setting interface is buttons on the back, white on white, hard to see, extremely frustrating when you have to reset it every week to keep the time correct. I'm going to toss them and buy something else.
customer_reviews.author: Donald S. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice, no other good points
customer_reviews.text: First unit came with dead battery so I sent it back. Second unit had dead battery as well. Both blinking 12 when first plugged in, both would reset to 12 if unplugged. I just put a new battery in and it worked fine, but it's not like it takes an easy 9v or AA batteries. CR2035, who doesn't have those laying around? On the plus side, it looks nice and dims to a good level in the dark. Those were my main reason for keeping it. If you intend to use the radio for more than waking up you should probably keep looking. Lousy sound and tuner.
customer_reviews.author: S.A.CT

customer_reviews.title: So-so
customer_reviews.text: So-so. The radio is one of the worst of getting channels, compared with other radios even handheld radios, but I live outside of the city. The clock is getting ahead around a minute every two months, little bit too much for my liking. The nice part about it is that if you loose power still have the backup battery. Another thing is kind of confusing with the time zone, I thought was supposed to change by itself, I'm not sure if I should give it another day to change but it never automatically changed for me. Maybe I just didn't figure this out.
customer_reviews.author: Steaua

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase
customer_reviews.text: Took me a couple of weeks to get used to it, but now I'm very happy with it. Adjustable brightness. Music or pleasant fluttering beep. Snooze for 10 minutes, but I have happy hands in sleep mode and have preferred the button twice, which doubles snooze. I didn't like that because I only have 10 minutes to spare. Happy with it in all other ways!
customer_reviews.author: M. Stenhaug

customer_reviews.title: I just love Amazon!
customer_reviews.text: When I turned the radio/clock on, the time was always 5 minutes ahead. I reset it a number of times, but even manually it still would stay 5 minutes ahead. I called Sony, but they couldn't help. I was to return it to Sony, but didn't have the receipt from Amazon. I returned it to Amazon pointing out that the time was 5 minutes ahead. Amazon did their magic in that I returned it and given credit on my card. I just love Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy.
customer_reviews.text: Worst alarm clock ever. I have given up on this alarm clock. For the last several months it has been 10 minutes behind, and there is seemingly no way to fix it. I still have the instructions that came with it. Also, it randomly turns DST on and off, which, as you can probably guess makes for some very hectic mornings. Do not buy. So many design flaws. Also, alarm isn't nearly loud enough for hearing impaired people.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Crites

customer_reviews.title: Works fine. Feels cheap
customer_reviews.text: Works fine. Feels cheap. Terrible sound, but I wasn't expecting good speakers on this thing. It's very practical and I use a plastic dimming sheet over the numbers so they don't keep me awake. If you're looking for good radio sound, this is not for you. But I listen to talk radio to fall asleep and wake up to as well. It's a disk tuner, which was a surprise, but my station comes in just fine. It's very easy to change/reset the alarm. It takes up very little space on my bedside table.
customer_reviews.author: Carol E.M.

customer_reviews.title: Good clock radio, but...
customer_reviews.text: I especially like it because it looks good, the sound is good, the radio is good, and you can adjust the clock brightness down further than my old similar Sony clock radio. The only problem with this one for me is that it has old fashioned dials for radio tuning and volume, which makes it a pain to change them in the dark. The radio dial is even difficult to read in the light, so I would not get this again.
customer_reviews.author: djchabot

customer_reviews.title: Love this clock
customer_reviews.text: I don't understand all the negative reviews. I love this clock. It is my second one. First one lasted 15 years, so I bought another to replace it. Love the low light time display and the ascending noise level of the alarm and small footprint. Some people just can't be pleased with anything so they just complain. In my opinion, it is a great alarm clock.
customer_reviews.author: Sailors2

customer_reviews.title: My clock defective -- sets itself ahead by an hour, randomly
customer_reviews.text: Great clock which met all my expectations, except that in the last two weeks, it has re-set itself one hour ahead two different times! The first time I thought it might have been associated with Daylight Savings Time, although it was 4 days before DST. But it just happened again last night, so it's not about DST. Clearly, the clock I have is defective, and I just found that March 2 was the deadline for returns. Very frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: A clock that doesn't keep time?
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a year ago or more, so this is after some use: It looks good, but to my amazement, it doesn't keep time that well. Like it's pretty far off over the course of a couple of weeks. Far less accurate than the average quartz wristwatch. Otherwise, it's pretty decent. Lighting on the letters won't keep you up at night and the controls give good, positive feedback. If the clock function wasn't it's primary function, it would be a 4/5.
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: Do not believe bad reviews!
customer_reviews.text: Had it for more than a month. Nearly perfect alarm clock. Great building quality, easy to use, not invasive led at low dim setting (also the warm color does not dilate the pupils in the eye). The alarm buzz is a little low in volume for me (I sleep with earplugs) but switching to the radio alarm you can adjust the volume. Also killer design, goes well both on a classic and modern bedroom furniture. At this price it is a steal. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Barbieri

customer_reviews.title: Best Clock Radio
customer_reviews.text: This radio is used at our timeshare property so when it was time to get a new one for our home, we were happy to buy it. The three levels of brightness for the clock display is an excellent option. The radio reception is great for both AM and FM. We keep our cellphones out of our bedroom to allow for REAL SLEEP so this simple alarm clock radio is an excellent answer to using our cellphones.
customer_reviews.author: F Coss

customer_reviews.title: Horrible product - but it looks cool!
customer_reviews.text: It looks cool. That's the only good thing I can say. The buttons are horrible; alarm button is hard tiny, hard to move, and always goes to the wrong setting; time setting is so unclear; turning off the radio is impossible to find except by accident. Now with all that said, the single WORSE thing about this radio is you can't read ANYTHING on the top. You practically have to have a spotlight and a magnifying glass to see what you're doing. The worst purchase I have ever made, period.
customer_reviews.author: Jon E.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Got the Sony Cube Clock after throwing out a clock I bought two weeks before (Peekeep Little Digital FM).. Had a Sony for years. Finally wore out. Should have bought this one in the first place. Very visible, high/low readout. Easy to set up. Easy alarm system. Easy instructions. Great radio reception.. Think it only comes in black, but that's a small detail for the quality. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked Great - for two years......then, not so much.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item exactly 2 years ago for my daughter on Amazon - and now it has gone belly up. You cannot set the time, nor the alarm - they remain locked at their current settings. The clock was never dropped or abused - it just inexplicably glitched out for no discernible reason. I picked Sony - and paid more for it - because there is perceived reliability. Clearly, in this case, I was mistaken. It worked fine otherwise - but 2 years is not at all what I expected when I purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: Raftman

customer_reviews.title: Decent but not without an issue
customer_reviews.text: Bought this several years ago to replace a dead Sony clock radio I had for a LONG time. It’s a good replacement. The only gripe I have is that it loses time. Guessing about a minute every coupe of weeks. That an electronic digital clock fails to keep time is evidence of some sort of electronic control problem that likely is not fixable by the user. My problem could be a one-off issue but it’s a bit irritating.
customer_reviews.author: C. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT buy this clock radio. It changes the ...
customer_reviews.text: Do NOT buy this clock radio. It changes the time automatically, apparently when it thinks Daylight Savings Time has started or ended. But it gets the dates of the change wrong, and only changes the time an hour backwards, not forwards. So when it's really 7 am, the clock says 6 am. It has done this to me twice and I've been late to work each time. Sony tech support tells me there's no way to stop this function.
customer_reviews.author: dcdoglover

customer_reviews.title: Great little cube.  Looks good and sounds good.
customer_reviews.text: Love this little clock. We bought it originally because we needed a clock for the baby's room. The all-white blended really with with the furniture and trim in there, and the subtle orange display on the almost paper-white background look really cool and understated. We don't use the alarm function much since it's in the baby's room, but it's good for listening to the news, weather, or even just some tunes when we're up there cleaning up or moving things around. Quality is good, as you'd expect from Sony. The power cord also seemed nice and long too, so we were able to put it right where we wanted without an extension cord.
customer_reviews.author: ChrisNorthJersey

customer_reviews.title: Counter-Intuitive
customer_reviews.text: Oh man I love the look of this but programming it was too frustrating for me. And I read the directions a few times, way too many buttons that need simultaneous activation, so far from intuitive it's not even funny.
customer_reviews.author: Circe Link

customer_reviews.title: Looks good, but not very user friendly or functional
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - Simple, Clean look - Dimmable - Slow wake alarm Cons: - Stopped working suddenly after 3 years - Not very user friendly - The Daylight Savings Time settings was confusing. It seemed to randomly switch. - The buttons are very hard to see (all black with small black text)
customer_reviews.author: NT44

customer_reviews.title: The perfect size to keep in the kitchen and listen to baseball games while I cook!
customer_reviews.text: I love this! I wanted a little clock radio for the kitchen so I could listen to San Francisco Giants games on the radio while I cooked. Cheaper than putting a TV in the kitchen, right? This radio is the perfect size! It's a cube, so it's easy to tuck behind a few things on the island without taking too much room. Also, the volume is perfect! I can hear it while I am washing dishes or while I am searing something on the stove.
customer_reviews.author: *Pearl

customer_reviews.title: Yes there is static noise, BUT WAIT AND HEAR ME OUT
customer_reviews.text: YES there is a static noise. If you keep this within 3 feet of your head, I would probably look for something different. Otherwise this clock is amazing. Its the perfect definition of modern, sleek, simple design. The radio is great, alarm is soft in the beginning and slowly gets louder. Im a heavy sleeper and I keep this at the end of my feet, and I love it. I personally don't mind the static that much, its not that noticeable unless you get within 3 feet and its quiet. Theres even a timer on the radio to fall asleep to music. I got mine in black.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy

customer_reviews.title: I purchased this one and love it! Just what I hoped it would be—simple
customer_reviews.text: I've used Sony clock radios for a long time—the last two each lasted about 10 years. I was sorry when my last one wore out. I purchased this one and love it! Just what I hoped it would be—simple, reliable, good sound, nice design. All that for a very reasonable price. I understand some commenters who've said the setting buttons are hard to see—they are!—but they're so logically designed and placed that I could easily change the settings without looking after a time or two. It's small, easy to set, sounds good enough, looks great, inexpensive! Hope it lasts another 10 years!
customer_reviews.author: B. Hay

customer_reviews.title: Lousy speaker and lousy radio
customer_reviews.text: The radio is analog with a very cheap bad precision tuning knob. The speaker is tinny and sound is bad. Look among the many Chinese branded low price model with much better features. On the plus side this unit has lots of buttons. Too bad the designer had no common sense and did dumb things like allocate a dedicated button to setting time zone.
customer_reviews.author: Klaus

customer_reviews.title: Ran to fast at my house
customer_reviews.text: It didn't keep the correct time, and I got tired of adjusting it every few months. I'm not sure if it was the electricity or the clock that was the problem, but I ended up junking it for an Alexa show, just to keep accurate time.
customer_reviews.author: S. B. Kim

customer_reviews.title: Good basic alarm clock, did what I needed it to do from day 1
customer_reviews.text: To address other issues mentioned: >No hum noted at all >Reception is good >Dimmer is excellent if you like to sleep with as little light as possible >The alarm (radio or buzzer) seems adjustable to me >Don't be surprised if it just says 12:00 when you plug it in. Mine did, and the year was set at 2014. I expect I'll need to replace the backup battery sooner than later >Don't throw out the instructions. Even if you've set up 20 alarm clocks, this one is a bit less intuitive
customer_reviews.author: CMB

customer_reviews.title: Sorry, but this was a turd
customer_reviews.text: It does NOT keep time. It doesn't matter how good or bad the other features are. I eventually sent this off to the thrift store. Too bad because it did have a good alarm and a really good range of brightness adjustments. I think setting the time and the alarm were a bit too complicated for no reason and - yes I did read the dimensions - but it is quite large - again - for no apparent reason. Take a pass on this one.
customer_reviews.author: Susan E

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: The amber display is really nice— dimmable also. Really easy to operate; small footprint. Only caveat I can think of is be sure to check the back up battery- mine was D.O.A. No big deal though these things sit in a warehouse. The instructions tell you how to know if the battery is dead. Read the instructions! Some of the negative reviews come from people not reading them. Sony almost always delivers a good product and this is another example.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Great clock radio! Highly desired gold numbers!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice looking, sleek clock radio that doesn't take up much space. I love the sleep timer which along with the gold colored numbers is why I bought it. I can't stand to see bright red, or green or blue numbers so I only choose gold. Gold numbers seem to be less invasive and distracting, at least in my insomniac prone opinion. I will say that I am a little confused about some of the functions but overall I really like this clock radio.
customer_reviews.author: D. Dellandrea

customer_reviews.title: Horrible
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine until I moved across the country. It won't let me change the time no matter how I try. So I had 4 other ppl who are electronics minded and they couldn't do it either. Don't waster your money. Even when I first bought it was very difficult to set the time properly. Radio is mostly static anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: Bad Quality
customer_reviews.text: The worst radio clock ever! I had the previous version of Sony radio clock (same looking) for over 25 years without any problem. I dropped the clock one day and I broke it. But this is a piece of junk. I used it less then 1 year and the time started to move slowly. Now it is running 25 min behind the actual time.
customer_reviews.author: Coco

customer_reviews.title: I did like the sound quality so another SONY was my first ...
customer_reviews.text: Had an very old Sony AM/FM clock radio with alarm, sleep timer and a CD player. It was a gift and not something I would have purchased myself. Too big and bulky and I never used the CD player. My cat knocked it off of the night stand many times which seemed to damage the FM tuner, over the years. I did like the sound quality so another SONY was my first choice. This is just right - small size, good sound, sleep timer for drifting off at night while listening to radio. Turns off in 30 minutes, by which time I'm sound asleep. Nothing fancy, just a nice radio/clock/alarm system. I'm happy with my choice.
customer_reviews.author: geri morgan

customer_reviews.title: Impossible to set the time
customer_reviews.text: Incredibly frustrating to try to set the time. This is not intuitive or user friendly. The "time set" button does not do anything. I bought this clock 2 years ago and I dread resetting the time every day light savings time change or whenever the clock gets unplugged. It is worth an extra $1-2 to get another clock that you can change the time in less than 1 minute (this one I have to look up on the internet).
customer_reviews.author: amanda

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 5 Years
customer_reviews.text: Clock lasted 5 years. Started losing a whole hour overnight every night. It was exactly an hour so I'm guessing the daylight savings time started messing up. Fine clock up until that started happening. I liked the ascending alarm function. Always hated other clocks that blasted you awake. Bad for the heart. lol.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Again something great from Sony but limitations
customer_reviews.text: Functioning as an alarm clock radio, it met all expectations. However, the smallness of the buttons and not only the smallness of the button label but also because there was no color to distinguish them from the black color of the unit itself created some difficulty in set up. Also Sony's habit of a single sheet of small print instructions with many folds can be confusion in moving from section to section..
customer_reviews.author: greyound

product_meta.title: Sony ICFC-1 Alarm Clock Radio LED Black
product_meta.description:
Color:BlackRise and shine with a Sony alarm clock radio. While a large, easy-to-read, backlit LCD display with jumbo LEDs make reading the time from across the room a snap, a battery back-up is also there to ensure that you never miss an important appointment or meeting again! (NOTE: The battery compartment is inside the cavity )

FROM THE MANUFACTURER


ALARM CLOCK WITH FM/AM RADIO
Rise and shine with a Sony alarm clock radio. While a large, easy-to-read, backlit LCD display with jumbo LEDs make reading the time from across the room a snap, a battery back-up is also there to ensure that you never miss an important appointment or meeting again!

LARGE, EASY TO READ LCD DISPLAY
Clearly view the time on the large, easy-to-read, backlit LCD display. Bright orange jumbo LEDs mean no squinting to read the time, even without your glasses.

GRADUAL WAKE ALARM
Normal alarm sounds with a preset volume are either too low to wake you up, or are so loud that you are awakened abruptly. The gradual wake alarm feature starts with a subtle, low volume that gradually increases to a reasonably high level in order to gently wake you from sleep.

ADJUSTABLE BRIGHTNESS CONTROL
With the adjustable brightness control you can ensure you are easily able to read the display during the day and not be distracted at night because the display is too bright when trying to sleep.

ENJOY FM/AM RADIO PROGRAMMING
A built-in analog FM/AM tuner lets you choose from a wide variety of radio, talk, and music programming.

PROGRAMMABLE SLEEP TIMER
Fall asleep to the radio using the programmable sleep timer.

SNOOZE BUTTON
For those mornings when you just can’t seem to wake up there’s a snooze button to let you catch a little extra shuteye. The sound turns off, but will automatically come on again after about 10 minutes.

BATTERY BACKUP
An optional backup battery keeps the clock working, even during a power outage.

AUTOMATIC DAYLIGHT SAVINGS TIME ADJUSTMENT
The built-in calendar even recognizes the date, automatically adjusting for Daylight Savings or Standard time.

EASY, AUTOMATIC TIME SET
Setup is a snap! The C1 comes preset to Eastern Standard Time, (EST), so all you need to do is plug it in, and set the correct time zone.

PRODUCT SPECIFICATIONS
 * Speaker Output:100 mW (at 10% harmonic distortion)
 * Clock:12-hour system
 * Alarm:Single Alarm (Choose from: Radio or Buzzer)
 * Autoclock Technology:Automatic Time Set and Automatic Daylight Savings Time Adjustment
 * Snooze w/Extendable Snooze:Extendable Snooze System-set from 10 to 60 minutes
 * Timer Clock:Sleep timer: 15 min./30 min./60 min./90 min.
 * Backlit Color:Amber
 * Day/Night Function:3 Step brightness control (Hi, Mid, Low Mode)
 * Display:Large, Easy to Read Amber Backlit, Smoked LCD Display with Brightness Control
 * Power Back-up:3 V DC, one CR2032 Lithium Battery
 * Power Requirements:120 V AC, 60 Hz
 * Frequency Range:FM 87.5 MHz - 108 MHz, 0.1 MHz Steps
   AM 530 kHz - 1710 kHz. 10 kHz Steps
 * Speaker Dimensions:Approximately 6.6 cm (2 5/8 inches) diameter, 8 Ohms
 * Tuning:Analog AM/FM Tuner
 * Dimensions (Approx.):4"x 4" x 4" (101 x 102 x 101 mm) not including projecting parts and controls
 * Weight (Approx.):1 lb. 13 oz. (490 g.) including CR2032 battery







* USB cable and smartphone are not included. Not all smartphones are compatible.
 2014 Sony Electronics Inc. All rights reserved. Reproduction in whole or in part without written permission is prohibited. All other trademarks are trademarks of their respective owners. Features and specifications are subject to change without notice. Non-metric weights and measures are approximate and may vary.
feature_bullets: Wake to radio, buzzer, or gradual wake alarm
Fall asleep to the radio via the programmable sleep timer
Automatic Daylight Savings Time adjustment (NOTE: The battery compartment is inside the cavity )

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.8 out of 5 stars4,521 ratings3.8 out of 5 stars
